lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I roll against that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone who wants to make an insight check, go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, definitely higher than 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled low.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't roll any higher than that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you pull back and groan, except for Taryon, who looks broken and crushed, momentarily.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tary, Grog is teaching you the opposite of what to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean? Girls don't like the bad boy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you want to discover what girls actually like, ask girls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe talk to them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got three--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't talk at them. Talk to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe individually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wells of knowledge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no. Yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your hair is like angels coming down from the sky--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope, already lost it. Nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't talk at them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't talk to the hair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't you, for starters, ask them a question about themselves?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Instead of talking about yourself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't necessarily want to tell them things. You want to talk to them and learn about them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much money do you have?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oops.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) No, that's a question for me, darling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe find a question about her personality or about her past or something that interests her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Try again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Hi, I'm Taryon Darrington.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi, Tary. Pleasure to meet you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice to meet you. So, what do you like to do at night? Do you have a servant who brushes your hair, or do you just brush your own? No. Have you killed-- no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At some pubs, that could have gone well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're getting close. Just try, for once, to think about someone other than yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, she goes back to the table to bring you your third round. As she does, she goes and returns all the mugs to the table, finishing with yours. She slides it forward to you and gives you a wink.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A wink?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Later tonight, player!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry we got off on the wrong foot earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "It's okay."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was taken by your obvious beauty, but there's so much more to you than that, I'm sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One thing about herself!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell me about yourself. How do you feel about-- What do you do during the day when the pub's not open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's taken aback for a moment. Looks at everyone else at the table with a "who are you people?" look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, Matt. What does she do during the day when the pub's not open? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a writer and a reader. What are your hobbies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My hobbies involve raising two children after Darren left about ten years back, and "working hard to make some money and hopefully one day get out of this shithole tavern and maybe "start a business doing some sort of, I don't know, textile work. Which, by the way, I brought your "thread and needle." And she throws down what looks like a half-done, shoddy knitting job.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those children are lucky to have a mother as hard-working as you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're lucky to have a mother in this day and age."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grabs one of your drinks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm glad to hear that you have a family because it would be a shame for someone like you to be alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Honey, are you having a hard time asking questions? I get the sense that you're new to this "whole thing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yes, I am. I don't know what I'm doing, and I'm floundering a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was not hard to read from you. Let me tell you, the first thing that helps a lot? Ask "what their name is."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shauna. Shauna Rual. What's your name?"

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: Taryon Darringon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "First thing you told me. Didn't even ask first."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is that mother's name? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bringing it all back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There you go. Now it's nice to meet you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's lovely to meet you. I could end the evening right now having learned a lot from you already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Great. I'll come back with the next round." She leaves the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shauna!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She is awesome. I like her a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think the lesson went well tonight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm feeling very positive about the whole deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel inv-- I'm speechless.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The alcohol has worked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, a draw, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel that this is a reasonable draw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why? I'm hooking up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We'll continue, then, until this is done.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fine, jeez. Draw. Just because.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many more things on that list, Tary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you simmer, Grog, you pull up your tankard and take a sip, and it is the most watered-down ale you've ever had in your life.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rest my head on Keyleth's shoulder and say, I almost wish we were back in the City of Dis right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woof.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Woof.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What for?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've had enough of that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How come? Did you like it there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it was terrible. Everything looked the same. It was dark, it was gray, it was full of fucking nightmares.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: People were being tortured. We saw it happen. Oh! We saw a torture chamber. You would have loved it! I thought of you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you get anything out of it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I almost did, and I felt really weird about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take it back, we did meet one really cool person.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We met a bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You met a bear?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A werebear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Werebear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A werebear there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did they make friends with Trinket?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket was-- I think he had a bit of a crush. Trinket, did you have a crush on Tova?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look back and Trinket is sitting by the doorway, which has been great, because every time a patron walks in, they go, "Hey. Huh?" And slowly has to step a wide circle around the bear that's just sitting right by the entrance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: An armored bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it that you miss about the City of Dis?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I was being facetious.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just meant that performance was a little tense, Tary. But a better towards the end.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're improving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, look at you, asking questions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Learning names.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Surviving hell, talking to women.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Talking-- oh, yes. I haven't picked up a woman in a bar before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was that on your list?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you have--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You've picked up a woman before, but just not in a bar?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have noticed at this point, by the way, that Shauna has set down food at a nearby table and is listening in to this conversation as you progress.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or any, for that matter. As I told you, I led a sheltered life, and I've really only had one romantic experience.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it with Doty?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. Doty was a machine made of metal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not judging.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's not judging.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would have been my first question, too. I'm not going to lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a terrible joke.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've never met anybody like Doty before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was a bit awkward with girls before I started out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You? Debonair?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had a lot of sisters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Royal?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we end up sheltered, don't we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got really good technique. He always brings a bottle of liquor with him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I learn very quickly. She's an excellent teacher. Never mind. But no, adventuring and going out into the world, you learn a lot. You meet people. You get out. It's good for you. Look at all these people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was very sheltered-- (gasps) were all three of us sheltered on this side?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are sheltered children on this side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay, sheltered kids! Hey. Awkward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this conversation, Taryon, you feel a hand hit your shoulder and turn you back a little bit. It's Shauna. She leans forward and says, "Listen, honey. If you're "looking to go ahead and find yourself an evening, wait here about 30 minutes. I'll introduce you to "someone." And she releases your shoulder and goes back to work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is also why you always make friends with women. They have friends. There's just networks of them. It's brilliant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is some of the best advice I've ever heard leave your mouth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is so great. The one romance you had before, did it go well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it did not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It didn't?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god. No. Wait. No!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what did you say? What did I miss?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did your father find out about--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My father did find out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What happened to her?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: More liquor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we're sitting down for parental issues.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We all scooch up chairs. What happened?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is part of the initiation process, Tary. We all went through this. Tell us everything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys are friends, right?

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My father, as I told you, has threatened to give the entire legacy of his estate to my sister because he doesn't feel that I am ready to take the reins. I'm not strong enough, and I'm not vicious enough. But it's more than that. He caught me with a teacher, a tutor, once.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He gave me all the best tutors.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I learned a lot, but there was one who taught me some extra things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What was her name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His name. It's embarrassing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no, I think I know. Please, go on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lawrence.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) Good name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Larry. Larry and Tary.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's adorable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's so adorable! I'm so sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He and I hit it off. We would talk about literature and philosophy and all sorts of things until the wee hours, and my father walked in on us once, and I don't know what happened to him, but I'm afraid he's dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Tary.

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I never saw him again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's awful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much older was he than you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten years older than me.

lines.name: ASHLEY, MARISHA
lines.text: How old were you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This was a few years ago, so maybe 20.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh, all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you confronted your father? Did you try to find out what happened to Lawrence?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wasn't a little boy! No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You didn't lead with that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tary, why didn't you tell us that? Maybe we've been taking the wrong approach this whole time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm a dashing adventurer, and I'm supposed to attract all of the lasses of the kingdom, right?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They throw themselves at me because of my derring-do and bravery and my hair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you experienced that once?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but I feel that-- in all the books I've read, they never tell of the adventurers who go to bed with older men.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you know why? Because those adventurers are busy actually having a good time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has anything you've gone through with us been like the books you've read?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing at all. No backup plan, no exit strategy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And why do you think that would be any different than our dating strategy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything you've read about romance, well, that's horseshit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should find Lawrence! We should see if we can find him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's probably dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should scry on him!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a reminder of him? Any items?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nothing? Can you describe him? Would it work?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was tall. He was fair-skinned. He was strong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Since we're friends now, and you're learning about us, what does your father do that you suspect he killed this poor man?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Real estate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Real estate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's a land baron?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never trust a man who sells property.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mostly buys and holds. Leases them back to the kingdom who sold it to him for a huge markup, and charges taxes on people that use the properties, exorbitant taxes. And he shakes down people who use his properties. It's all very shady and murky, but it all involves real estate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't want to be that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you like your father?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a great man. He's made a lot of money, and he's respected and feared by many.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We just killed a dragon that made a lot of money.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you like your father?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hate him, more than anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then why do you feel like you need to impress him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because-- I don't know. He's my dad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got you, boo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Daddy issues.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I kind of want to rough him up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rough me up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, not you. You're fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've already put you through the ringer, darling. You're fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can stay with us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do whatever you like.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And be poor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or slightly wealthy. There's worse things than poverty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's more to respect and honor than just money. A lot more. In fact, generally money tends to make you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Miserable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shittier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't fully agree with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Although I spent quite a bit of time before I met this group of people dirt poor. Beggar poor. It wasn't the best time of my life, but-- I don't remember my point. It was actually pretty awful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think if we're going to bring up how you shat on money when we first met you and talked about how it was pointless and didn't bring you happiness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's true. I did say it was pointless.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did give it away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And because it comes with an enormous amount of responsibility and complications. And while it's nice to have, because I'm using it to do some good in the world now, and because without it, she becomes slightly more questionably evil than she currently is, bless.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's so evil.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It can augment existing happiness, it just doesn't create it from scratch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we're suddenly talking about your problems.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or baking bread. I'm not sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still your problems, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to drink more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tary, did you want to get laid tonight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think Grog's offering.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I do, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I'll pay for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a house of ill repute?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Have you ever been to the lady favors?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It actually has a very good reputation, to be fair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A brothel?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taryon Darrington in a house of flesh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you go in, throw some spaghetti on the wall, see what sticks, and have a great time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's not actual spaghetti.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groaning, laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Yay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you think, huh? I know if we had said, "you're going to fight a dragon and a "kraken," you'd be like, "no, not me!" But this is a chance for you to go to the big time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe take some pressure off and practice talking normally to people who are going to be very gentle with you about the whole process.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Talking?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't even have to do anything. You can just have an hour of their time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, are you encouraging me to go to a brothel right now?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Listen, I do think that going to, as you put it, a house of flesh, is a part of being an adventurer. It's a rite of passage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you go to brothels, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, where do you think I go when you guys leave all the time? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike is crushing it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I missed you so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then why did we get mimosas and go shopping when we had our girls' day?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Say again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why did we get mimosas and just go shopping on our girls' day? I feel like we got robbed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, those are so fun, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't go shopping next time. I never do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax and Vex, as you guys are having this conversation, you notice that Shauna's in the progress of conversing with a figure at the bar who sat down not too long ago. You can only see from the back, but you see a set of armor that is Pale Guard-specific. They have a brief conversation, and the figure turns around and begins to approach the table after glancing over the shoulder a few times towards where you guys are sitting. As you guys are talking, from behind Taryon, a large figure looms up from behind and smiles, as you guys recognize, with the brunette hair pulled back into a tight bun behind, the healing scar on the face, you see Tricia, one of the Pale Guard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! She beat me at arm wrestling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trish the Dish!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Totally Trish the Dish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she walks up and leans and touches the edge of your shoulder, pats you, and goes, "Hey, "so I've had a long day. I've been told you've had a long day."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I have. I lost--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I buy you a drink?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just say yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What'll you have?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your finest, oldest wine, I guess?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gotcha. Scotch. All right." She backs away, walks back up to the bar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was hot. Damn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You see how she did that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, learn from Trish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm learning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like I just learned something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't quote fairytales anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, unless you want you. If that's the way you think you're going to pick up a girl or a guy, maybe that's the way and you'll just find somebody who likes that. You might get a lot of rejection until that point, but eventually you'll find the person that it registers with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two glasses slam down on the table in front--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you'll just have a great time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pours a really thick amber-like liquid into each of these. Slams the drink down. Pulls her bun out, her hair curled up and crimped from being put up falls around the shoulder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (coughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do not puke. Do not puke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're doing great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shauna, we're taking the bottle. They call me Trish. What's your name?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, TD, let's go and have a walk in the moonlight." She takes you by the arm, lifts you out of your chair onto your feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, she lifted me up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Still working out?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. But I probably couldn't take you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I knew you couldn't. See you next Winter's Crest, right? All right. Have a good night. You're "coming with me." She smacks you on the ass as she pushes you out of the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell my story! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as Trish, who's a good seven or eight inches taller than Taryon, is guiding him with one hand in the center of his back just pushing him out of the tavern. You see them both disappear into the now dark--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dude, I had a thing for Trish once upon a time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know you did. Are you okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you still?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I mean--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it a little painful?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You could go rescue him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could. He's not going to be into it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I am not CB-ing that action, all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: CB-ing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, canary blocking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could we get an insight if Taryon seemed excited or just terribly scared?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better than what I rolled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taryon?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very scared.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not happy? Not happy at all or like cool?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Interested but scared.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think he needs this. I think it'll be all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree with Percy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hope he likes it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is so uncomfortable to talk about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to think about that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have your orb?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uhh. Why you asking, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why you asking, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to double-check. It'll be fine. Just going to double-check, real quick. They haven't started anything yet. I'm just going to take a peek.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to give that a big fat no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if I owe you a favor?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Voice of the Tempest is overruling you on this one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm appealing beyond the Voice of the Tempest, to the heart of the storm. I'm asking the heart of the storm, pleading to the heart of the storm far beyond the Voice of the Tempest. There's nothing to be heard here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: La-la-la, the Voice is very loud right now. Sorry, the Voice cannot hear you. The Voice is going to have to take a message.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could always try following them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, why don't you go walk down the hallway?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't want to disturb them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's outside the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they know that we're watching it would disturb them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go make sure everything's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go listen in and make sure everything's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They stepped out of the tavern. They went out into the street.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You were the one who told me that I could not scry on Scanlan to respect his privacy so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but I give a shit about Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, he's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's not here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's my best friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's dopey but he means well. He's all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. We don't want him to die outright.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, of course not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to watch a Tary porn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't have to watch. I just want to watch. It's just me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're very strongly peer pressuring me right now Percy and I don't know how I feel about this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's because we're peers. I'm a bit drunk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you even scry? I don't know if you have the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. I've never tried.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to try?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, Percy. Try to scry. I give him the Scrying Eye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it require attunement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Scrying Eye does not require attunement, no. It gives the ability to use the Scry spell once per day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See what you can do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and use it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just for the sake of this, I'm going to have you roll a d20 and add your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If he crits, I'm going to be so pissed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I use a Resolve for this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Resolve is for a saving throw, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that doesn't work, does it? That's seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead of thinking of the magical orientation of the ritual, your brain immediately goes to the mechanical structure of what this would do. How would you recreate the scrying spell in a mechanical fashion where it wouldn't require magic. You're eventually at the point where, "I don't understand this."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't understand how this works. Never mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really? Are you sure? You have to think real hard about butt-naked Tary. Real hard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One more time. Just bring the difficulty up. I don't care.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the DC is definitely higher. Go ahead and roll again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tan lines where his armor used to be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Luscious hair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm thinking about Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh, you sneaky fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you want to say this out loud?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what, guys? If I could have you all, except for Taliesin, go ahead and step off the stage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do they get to know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. A reverse whisper.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a group whisper!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The audience gets to see this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I get to stay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do, actually. He does get to stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I get to stay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys. Close the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're closing it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're putting headphones on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the second time in a week I've gotten to do this to people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wow! The reverse whisper!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's four farm folk, and you see sitting amongst them Kaylie and Scanlan. They're both together playing music for these people who are all sitting and staring into the fire at the end of their work day. It's a very simple, very serene scene, strangely. They're just sitting with simple folk in a simple town. You recognize it now: this is the Turst Fields. You've been through here once before, when you were first leaving Whitestone and heading south to find your quarry, all that time ago. This is definitely a more rural area, and they don't seem to be in any danger, and they don't seem to be at any caper, but they're both at the center of doing what they both do best, which is entertain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do they look reasonable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're both wide smiles. Everyone else seems to be enthralled by the music, or enthralled by the flames and the music combination. A couple of people saunter up and plop down on the ground, sitting next to them to join in, and they're drawing a small crowd at the end of the day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take down as many details in my head as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Bring them back in. Guys, get back here!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or should we just take our break here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What time is it? It is 8:30! We'll go ahead and take our break, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thanks, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have our giveaway. We have the bubinga complete system and tabletop tray from Wyrmwood. This one has a bunch of stuff. We have a dice box, dice tray-- this is actually a pretty legit giveaway, so go ahead and make sure you come to the Twitch chat room and be active. They'll have a password up there. Do we have a code yet for the chat room?

lines.name: CREW
lines.text: Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, and welcome back. As you guys are having your drinks at the bar, Percival finishes focusing briefly on the Scrying Orb and disengages.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ha! Oh, that's a bit much. That's a bit much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What did you see?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing that interesting. Ugh, that doesn't feel good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing that interesting, or something appallingly interesting?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Believe me, I'd tell you if it was appalling. It was not appalling, it was fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is Tary okay? What are you thinking, man?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's fine, he's having a good-- That doesn't feel good. How do you do that? Ugh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check on him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just to see if he actually saw anything or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If he's telling us the truth. 26.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, and that would be-- okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, 27.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The question, was if you saw anything or not?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, it seems like he definitely saw something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? It worked, though!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You actually got it to work for you! I'm kind of impressed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think I'm ever doing that again, but yes. That doesn't feeling good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He crossed the threshold? Is that what you saw?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't see that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What did you see?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to be a gentleman and not throw up from the speed at which one goes in that direction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, Percival, you threw "gentleman" out the window about 30 seconds ago.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair. He's doing very well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very well. I'm very proud.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So question, do we crash here for the night or do we make it back to the (hiccup) castle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should probably go to the castle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got to say hi to your sister.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do. We've sent word. They'll be awake, I imagine. Is Gilmore still in town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last you heard-- you can ask around-- Gilmore is back in Emon currently trying to scavenge the pieces of his shop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we do it old school and just crash here for the night? That way, Tary can take his time and in the morning we (hiccup) oh god I got so much burps-- Then in the morning we can head back out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Head back out, where?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To the (hiccup) castle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are real hiccups, aren't they?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might be nails.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have both, so that's, either way, it could work.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can sleep anywhere, but why aren't we going to sleep in the nice beds in the castle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have lovely beds.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But we've got to wait on Tary!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he's not going to know where we went.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tary's a big boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're right, he's not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll leave a message here. He's a smart boy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like he's just so romantic, he'll probably stay the night and have breakfast or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, look, you may go back to your fluffy bed, but my man's in the deed and I'm sticking around to slap hands afterwards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Shauna around at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's in the process of running around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I run up and snag her for a second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. She sets down a couple of drinks. "I feel like we did our good deed for the night."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like it happened. It definitely happened. Question, though. How long does your friend usually stay with her cohorts? Does it-- Is it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't time it, if that's what your question is. I don't know!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does she spend the night with them, or is it like an in and out-- Do you see her again, around, quickly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A few times, it depends on--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It depends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On the guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She's a hard working girl, let her have her fun."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I agree with that sentiment. Thank you for your generosity, and your connections.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Silver tongued, huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, she smiles very widely and you can see the mother poke through for a minute from the barmaid. She nods and says, "Look, it's all right. Trust me, I deal with far worse from "most of these riffraff." She points to most of the other tables. "It's fine."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gets back to work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I dunno, I think he might be with her a long time. He might be learning a few things. It could take all night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope he's learning a lot of things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, did it look like he was?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was not there very long.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's just go back to the castle. It's just a few blocks away from the tavern. We can always come back in the morning to send someone to get him, it's fine. It's a small West-- Whitestone-- we're not in Westruun. We've traveled. We've traveled a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're four mugs in, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: God, is it just, you know, we travel so much, you don't really know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really, really far in for Keyleth, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is so many glasses that she's far in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, because I am not as tired as you guys-- I have been working so hard, but I'm going to stay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, me too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Gonna wait for Tary.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (belches) Keep an eye on our 34,000 gold-onaire. Sorry, it smells like a fart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, he's my best friend and I love all of him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fair, you probably have some catching up to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are finding your respective places to stay for the night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back to the castle, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The four of you head back to the castle. The two of you stay in the tavern. Taryon continues with his evening. The four of you make it back. Is there anything in particular you want to do? At this point in the evening, you've been drinking quite a ways, so it's closer to midnight at this point in time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a little soberer than I'd like to let on. Not sober, but-- I don't quite want to say surprise for tomorrow, but I may have something exciting to show you tomorrow. I'm going to need you to be extra intimidating tonight, because tomorrow I'm going to be very intimidating right back at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like this plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I figured you would. I'm going to have to say hello to my sister.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Do I need to come with you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. Are we alone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys could fall behind the two of them if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't look in on Tary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you not see anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I saw Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You seemed bothered after you looked. Is everything all right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was he doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't done anything yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Enjoying himself. God knows. He has things that belong to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has the stone--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I sort of gave that to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has the earring.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I kind of want them back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't think there's any chance he'll ever come back, do you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He would have been such a-- Hm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, it's funny, he left feeling like we didn't appreciate his worth, and these last few weeks have really made me understand how much I did. I think he hit on a lot of really good points when he left us. I don't forgive him for them just yet, but I'm trying not to hate him for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not. I've been that villain, and the best of them point out all of your flaws while they're busy exploiting their own. I am, I will admit, very angry. I don't want to interfere with his happiness, I don't want to interfere with his life, certainly not his daughter, but I will admit I am very angry. Perhaps the only thing that's keeping me from doing anything about that anger is your opinion of it. I don't mean to put this on you, this is not on you, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not at all, dear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm thinking of collecting what's mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull out Fenthras, and I show him again what I've carved on the front of it. Sinaeth. Do you remember when I told you about this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's important. I struggle with it a lot, you know. I tend to hold grudges.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As do I.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we're trying, that's important. Just think on it. Nothing rash, dear, all right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I'll be in the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be right there. I'm going to confer with my sister about formalizing a few things tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before Percy leaves, I say, (slurs) You know, didn't think, going to be able to use the Scrying Eye, for someone who hates magic so much, might be something more to you! Boop! I saw that from Whatsherface earlier! Okay, bye, go have fun!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to jump us back two minutes, and I'm not as sober as Percival, and we're arm-in-arm walking. Man, I'm so fucking happy right now, I'm so fucking happy. We have nothing to do. We have nothing to do!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (slurs) I just can't believe Percy actually used the Scrying Eye. I so didn't anticipate him actually getting it able to work. I thought I was one of the only ones in the group that can make it work, and now he can make it work.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your home! Your home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man. What are-- I don't know what you're referring to in this moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, Zephra.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This feels like a lot of meta conversations.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zephra. I want to go to Zephra. I want to get to know your father!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's nice! He's so much nicer than my father ever was!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're so domestic right now, it's so cute!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, there's been no time to talk about this. I mean, we get to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, do you think they're going to stop allowing you to drink in the street as soon as we get guards and law and order back in this town? I kind of like you being able to drink in the street in Whitestone. It's nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Wait, wait, wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you going to say?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Focus in on me, because I have something important to tell you, but I know that we're both very intoxicated.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, yeah. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I love her so much!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's my best friend!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know! I love her so much too!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's the coolest!

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys both look ahead to talk about and look at Vex, she's gone and Percy's gone, and you realize at this point that you completely missed the divergence of your party.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love you so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percival. The castle's dark, it's quiet. The few lights that are up in the sconces on the secondary floor as you make your way towards your sister's chambers. You come to the door, and her personal guard is there, in Pale Guard armor. As soon as you begin to approach the steps, gets into a defensive position and then recognizes you and steps back and leads you in. As you come inside, you see Cassandra is currently in her regular day-to-day clothing, one of her many outfits she uses for formal meetings. Her hair is a little frazzled and down in front of her face. She has a stack of sheets stacked up next to her at this small desk table that she has in front of one of her large red velvet sitting chairs. However, she's not looking at that right now, as she's currently enthralled with what looks to be a small stack of cakes and a little tea saucer she's holding up as she's sipping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's just layers to that trouble, isn't there? Just layers of paperwork.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns back and looks at you. You see a little bit of the cake curl at the edge of her mouth. "Percival!" Takes another sip of the tea and sets it down. "You've returned!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a while, this time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How have your travels been?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Terrible, but all over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That sounds par for the course, I assume."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm back to help. It's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good! As the sophist of native ingenuity, you have much responsibility in this time of "recovery, and I'm growing a bit weary of the burden."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I grab a slice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She hands it over to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do ask tomorrow that we handle this little interesting tidbit. I hand her the documents I put together earlier with the titling that needs to be dealt with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it and goes, "Huh. Grand Poobah, that's-- we'll certainly discuss that."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I expect somebody will come up with something delightful for that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can take our time with that one. I'm not going to lie, it's been so long, I've forgotten we have not had any purveyor of the Grey Hunt."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Quite a while. A long while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, Vex'ahlia."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It seemed appropriate. Even before things became what they are, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Before we can officiate that she has to undergo the Hunt itself."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know how that works."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keeper Yennen might."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He does, if I recall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keeper Yennen should know. I'm a bit out of my depth at this point. I've done--" You see she sighs deeply and looks over at her garden-- For the first time in a while, you see Cassandra break from the stoic leader to Cassandra, your sister, and she leans forward and takes your hand and goes, "I'm so very tired. I've missed you. I need your help. Please."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to make this right. We're going to-- the machine will run again. All of this will work again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know. They're good people, many good people here, and you've all saw to that. I've saw "to it. I need rest."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. There's more cake in it for you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could use more cake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She wipes a little tear from her face. "I'm glad you're safe."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How goes the training of the company of shot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's functional as it can be. We're having to ration ammunition as we have to rely on you for "that and you've been gone."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we're going to fix that as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps you should helm most of that training since the majority effort has been at the "hip and making things up as they go."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The guards? The captain of the guards has been taking care of everything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, yes. We lost a few in the last altercations but we have a good long standing "number of individuals who have stepped up and what was his name? The one that you brought in?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jarett.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Jarett."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he still around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's been very useful. He's taken care of most of the low-end training but--" (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to confer with him very quickly before I go to sleep but other than that we are back and I look forward to making this move forward tomorrow morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lady Vex'ahlia to breakfast in the morning and we "shall discuss her position, responsibilities, and the necessity of the Hunt."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course." She leans back in her chair and (sighs). "I think it's time for bed." And she gets up and she goes and closes off the fireplace in the corner and throws a little bit of water onto it and puts out the candles in the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run by Jarett's on the way back to my quarters.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jarett currently stays down in the barracks within the city of Whitestone proper because he's responsible for training the recruits and helping build up their skills.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Real quick, I'm just going to write a little post. I'm just going to write a little letter which I will tell you about in-- well, should I tell you what it is now because the person who sent it--

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to throw a little cash and I'm going to write a little letter. I'm going to ask Jared to very very quietly--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jarett.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jarett. So sorry. Jarett. I know.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very quietly on the sly hire someone to keep very, very distant tabs on Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to know if anything unusual happens. Not to interfere. Just watch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Capone voice) I want him dead. I want his family dead. I want his house burned to the ground!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five gold pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 copper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That could probably get it done. For a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, until he needs more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. He's a smart man. He's done different forms of business. He can let you know if you need to restock the coffers, if you will. So the letter's written up, assuredly delivered, and the evening comes to a close for you guys. At the tavern, here at the Tipsy Quorum, we have Pike and Grog catching up on crazy business amongst the rest of the jovial atmosphere of the tavern as people have been drinking heavily into the evening like a city that is still recovering from five years of perpetual torment does.

You glance over and as the tavern is still open, it doesn't really close per se, but the night shift-- You see Shauna's finishing. She's throwing a shawl over, she's getting ready to leave. She looks over and sees you and takes off her shawl and throws it around Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: "All right. Well, I guess find a stool and curl up. I'm going to bed." And she leaves.

lines.text: She leaves. Closes the door behind her. You can choose to eventually pass out with Grog if you want as well or--

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she starts getting ready and a couple of the other bar hands start setting up the tavern, you hear footfalls come rushing down and you watch as Trisha comes rushing down, putting on her armor real fast. She's going, "Shit, shit. I'm late! Shit, shit, shit." and just rushes out the door.

lines.name: ASHLEY
